html.display_name: Summary of Rank and Nullity for Linear Transformations from R^n to R^m
html.p: Let [mathjaxinline]T: \mathbb R^{n}\rightarrow \mathbb R^{m}[/mathjaxinline] be a linear transformation with standard matrix [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline]. The nullity of [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] will equal the number of free variables when [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] is row reduced, and the rank of [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] will equal the number of pivot columns when [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] is row reduced. The columns of [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] which correspond to the pivots will form a basis of the image of [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline].
